input: Endodynamic geological processes include ().
expected_output: Tectonism, earthquake, magmatism, metamorphism
actual_output: Endodynamic geological processes include tectonic plate movements, volcanic activity, and mountain building.

input: The intensity of river erosion mainly depends on (), etc.
expected_output: Flow velocity, rock properties that make up the riverbed, and sediment concentration in the flowing water
actual_output: The intensity of river erosion mainly depends on **gradient, discharge, sediment load, and vegetation cover**, etc.

input: Glacier denudation can form () and other special landforms
expected_output: Enclosed valley, U-shaped valley, ice bucket, horn peak, suspended valley, edge ridge.
actual_output: Glacier denudation can form cirques and other special landforms.

input: There are four main forms of sea water movement.
expected_output: Wave, tide, ocean current, turbidity current
actual_output: There are four main forms of sea water movement: currents, tides, waves, and thermohaline circulation.

input: Limestone is composed of () minerals.
expected_output: calcite
actual_output: calcium carbonate (CaCO₃) and magnesium carbonate (MgCO₃)

input: D is the code of ().
expected_output: devonian
actual_output: D is the code of Delta.

input: The way to lengthen the river is
expected_output: Tracing erosion, meandering, delta formation
actual_output: The way to lengthen the river is by following its course from the source to the mouth, including all its tributaries and meanders.

input: The most significant zone of sea erosion is
expected_output: Coastal zone
actual_output: the coastline, where wave action, currents, and tides continuously shape and reshape the land.

input: The deposition of () marks the final stage of chemical deposition of salt lakes.
expected_output: chloride
actual_output: evaporite formation

input: Granite is ().
expected_output: Intrusive rock
actual_output: Granite is an **igneous** rock composed mainly of **quartz**, **feldspar**, and **mica**.

input: The zone with the strongest wave erosion is ().
expected_output: Coastal zone
actual_output: The zone with the strongest wave erosion is the **shoreline**.

input: The zone with the most frequent development of turbidity is ().
expected_output: Continental slope
actual_output: The zone with the most frequent development of turbidity is the continental slope.

input: The main site of marine sedimentation is ()
expected_output: Neritic zone.
actual_output: The main site of marine sedimentation is the ocean floor.

input: Due to the continuous expansion of the sea floor, the age of the ocean crust gradually increases with the increase of the distance from the ocean ridge ().
expected_output: Grow old
actual_output:
mid-ocean ridge. 

So the completed sentence is: Due to the continuous expansion of the sea floor, the age of the ocean crust gradually increases with the increase of the distance from the ocean ridge mid-ocean ridge.

input: Most of the glacial valleys shaped by glaciation have a cross section of () shape.
actual_output: Most of the glacial valleys shaped by glaciation have a cross section of U-shape.

input: The reason for the strong folding of the rock stratum is
expected_output: Strong horizontal extrusion.
actual_output: The reason for the strong folding of the rock stratum is due to intense tectonic forces and pressure during mountain-building processes.

input: Angular unconformity is usually associated with ().
expected_output: The occurrence of underlying strata is inconsistent
actual_output: Angular unconformity is usually associated with tilted or folded sedimentary rock layers.

input: The lithology that can become a good water-resisting layer is ()
expected_output: Mudstone (shale).
actual_output: The lithology that can become a good water-resisting layer is **clay**.

input: The boundary of plate structure is ()
expected_output: Separation type boundary, aggregation type boundary and dislocation type boundary.
actual_output: The boundary of plate structure is defined by tectonic plate interactions, which can be classified into three main types: divergent, convergent, and transform boundaries.

input: The main geophysical methods used to divide the structure of the earth's inner sphere are
expected_output: Seismic wave method.
actual_output: seismic reflection, seismic refraction, gravity surveys, magnetic surveys, and electrical resistivity.

input: The chronostratigraphic units are (); The geological age unit is ().
expected_output: Universe, boundary, system, system and stage; Era, generation, era, era and period
actual_output: The chronostratigraphic units are **strata**; The geological age unit is **eon**.

input: The earth can be divided into three circles from the surface to the center. These three circles are
expected_output: Atmosphere, hydrosphere, biosphere (crust, mantle, core).
actual_output: crust, mantle, and core.

input: The Mesozoic can be divided into three periods from old to new, namely
expected_output: Triassic (T), Jurassic (J) and Cretaceous (K).
actual_output: The Mesozoic can be divided into three periods from old to new, namely the Triassic, Jurassic, and Cretaceous.

input: The occurrence factors of rock stratum include
expected_output: Inclination, strike and dip.
actual_output: the geological history of the area, the types of sedimentary processes involved, the mineral composition of the sediments, the depositional environment, tectonic activity, and climatic conditions.

input: According to the depth of sea water, the marine environment can be divided into
expected_output: Coastal zone, shallow zone, semi-deep zone and deep zone.
actual_output: the epipelagic zone, mesopelagic zone, bathypelagic zone, abyssopelagic zone, and hadalpelagic zone.

input: According to the direction of river erosion, it can be divided into
expected_output: Mechanical erosion and chemical erosion.
actual_output: According to the direction of river erosion, it can be divided into longitudinal, lateral, and vertical erosion.

input: The three elements of geomagnetism are
expected_output: Magnetic field strength
actual_output: the Earth's magnetic field, magnetic anomalies, and paleomagnetism.

input: The Paleozoic can be divided into six periods from old to new
expected_output: Cambrian ∈, Ordovician O, Silurian S, Devonian D, Carboniferous C, Permian P.
actual_output: The Paleozoic can be divided into six periods from old to new: Cambrian, Ordovician, Silurian, Devonian, Carboniferous, and Permian.

input: The main types of glaciers are
expected_output: Continental glaciers and mountain glaciers.
actual_output: alpine (or mountain) glaciers and ice sheets.

input: According to the content of silica in magma, it can be divided into
expected_output: Ultrabasic magma, basic magma, neutral magma and acidic magma.
actual_output: According to the content of silica in magma, it can be divided into felsic, intermediate, mafic, and ultramafic.

input: The Cenozoic can be divided into three periods from old to new. These three periods are
expected_output: Paleogene E, Neogene N, Quaternary Q
actual_output: Paleogene, Neogene, and Quaternary.

input: The active volcanoes in the world are concentrated in three zones, which are
expected_output: Pacific Rim, Tethys Belt, Mid-Ocean Ridge.
actual_output: the Pacific Ring of Fire, the Mediterranean-Asiatic Belt, and the Atlantic-Indian Ocean Ridge.

input: In the inclined fold, the axial plane is inclined, the rock strata on both wings are inclined (), and the dip angle is ().
expected_output: On the contrary, inequality
actual_output: In the inclined fold, the axial plane is inclined, the rock strata on both wings are inclined **in the same direction**, and the dip angle is **greater than zero**.

input: The main ways of physical weathering are
expected_output: Load release (unloading), thermal expansion and contraction of rocks and minerals, freezing and thawing of water (ice splitting), crystallization and deliquescence of salts.
actual_output: freeze-thaw cycles, thermal expansion and contraction, and biological activity.

input: According to the route of volcanic eruption, it can be divided into
expected_output: Penetration eruption, fissure eruption and central eruption.
actual_output: submarine, subaerial, and fissure eruptions.

input: According to the factors and properties of weathering, weathering is divided into
expected_output: Chemical weathering, physical weathering and biological weathering.
actual_output: mechanical (physical) and chemical weathering.

input: The tectonic movement is divided into
expected_output: Horizontal motion, vertical motion.
actual_output: The tectonic movement is divided into three main types: divergent, convergent, and transform boundaries.

input: According to the occurrence of axial plane, folds can be divided into
expected_output: Vertical fold, inclined fold, inverted fold, recumbent fold.
actual_output: symmetrical, asymmetrical, and overturned.

input: The contact relationship between intrusive rock and surrounding rock can be divided into
expected_output: Sedimentary contact, intrusive contact and fault contact.
actual_output: sharp, gradational, and transitional.

input: The process of seismic geological process can be divided into
expected_output: There are four stages: seismogenic, imminent, seismogenic and aftershock.
actual_output: The process of seismic geological process can be divided into **seismic data acquisition, data processing, interpretation, and modeling**.

input: The main mode of metamorphism is
expected_output: Recrystallization, metamorphic crystallization, metasomatism, metamorphic differentiation, tectonic deformation.
actual_output: The main mode of metamorphism is **regional metamorphism**.

input: The parent rock of the sediment includes
expected_output: Magmatic rock, metamorphic rock and sedimentary rock
actual_output: The parent rock of the sediment includes minerals such as quartz, feldspar, and mica, which are weathered and transported to form sedimentary deposits.

input: Three substances dissociated from the parent rock of sediment during weathering
expected_output: Debris, dissolved matter and insoluble residue
actual_output: Three substances dissociated from the parent rock of sediment during weathering are **silica**, **aluminum**, and **calcium**.

input: Chemical weathering destroys the original rock and forms new minerals
expected_output: clay mineral
actual_output: Chemical weathering destroys the original rock and forms new minerals such as clays, oxides, and hydroxides.

input: Main methods of sediment transport by running water
expected_output: Rolling handling, jumping handling, suspended handling
actual_output: Main methods of sediment transport by running water include traction, saltation, suspension, and solution.

input: Main methods of sediment transport by wind
expected_output: Jump, overhang, creep
actual_output: Main methods of sediment transport by wind include saltation, suspension, and creep.

input: Determinants of transport and deposition of substances in real solution
expected_output: solubility
actual_output: Determinants of transport and deposition of substances in real solution include factors such as fluid dynamics, chemical composition, temperature, pressure, and the presence of particulates or other solutes. These factors influence the movement and settling of substances within the solution, affecting processes like sedimentation, precipitation, and diffusion.

input: According to the nature of the transported materials, the sedimentation differentiation is divided into
expected_output: Mechanical deposition differentiation and chemical deposition differentiation
actual_output: According to the nature of the transported materials, the sedimentation differentiation is divided into mechanical and chemical sedimentation.

input: In the process of mechanical deposition differentiation, according to the particle size, the precipitated particles are
expected_output: Gravel, sand, silt, clay
actual_output: sorted into distinct layers, with larger particles settling first and finer particles settling on top.

input: The diagenesis process mainly includes
expected_output: Compaction, cementation, dissolution, alteration, metasomatism and recrystallization.
actual_output: compaction, cementation, dissolution, and recrystallization.

input: According to the difference of material sources, sedimentary rocks are divided into
expected_output: There are four major types of terrigenous clastic rocks, endogenous sedimentary rocks, pyroclastic rocks and sedimentary rock associations.
actual_output: clastic, chemical, and organic sedimentary rocks.

input: Minerals in sedimentary rocks can be divided into
expected_output: Terrigenous clastic minerals, authigenic minerals and secondary minerals.
actual_output: detrital minerals and authigenic minerals.

input: The structure of clastic particles can be divided into
expected_output: Excellent, good, medium
actual_output: The structure of clastic particles can be divided into **grain size, shape, and composition**.

input: The structure of clastic particles can be divided into
expected_output: Extremely angular, angular, sub-circular, circular, extremely circular
actual_output: The structure of clastic particles can be divided into **grain size, shape, and composition**.

input: The types of cement mainly include
expected_output: Basement cementation, pore cementation, contact cementation, filling cementation
actual_output: calcite, quartz, and clay minerals.

input: In bedding structure, what is the main composition of bedding
expected_output: Fine layer, layer system and layer system group
actual_output: In bedding structure, the main composition of bedding is layers of sediment or sedimentary rock.

input: Common biogenic structures
expected_output: Laminated structure, wormhole, wormhole
actual_output: Common biogenic structures include stromatolites, trace fossils, and bioturbation structures.

input: Common clastic components in terrigenous clastic rocks
expected_output: Quartz, feldspar, rock cuttings
actual_output: quartz, feldspar, and rock fragments.

input: Terrestrial clastic rocks are divided into
expected_output: Conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone, mudstone
actual_output: three main categories: conglomerates, sandstones, and shales.

input: Sandstone is divided into
expected_output: Very coarse sandstone, coarse sandstone, medium sandstone, fine sandstone, very fine sandstone
actual_output: Sandstone is divided into **arenite**, **wacke**, and **fossiliferous sandstone**.

input: Common clay minerals
expected_output: Kaolinite, illite, montmorillonite
actual_output: Common clay minerals include kaolinite, montmorillonite, illite, and chlorite. These minerals are typically formed through the weathering and hydrothermal alteration of silicate-bearing rocks and are characterized by their fine-grained structure and sheet-like morphology.

input: During compaction, the contact relationship between rigid particles in sandy sediment is shown as
expected_output: Point contact, line contact, bump contact, stitch contact.
actual_output: During compaction, the contact relationship between rigid particles in sandy sediment is shown as point contacts or grain-to-grain contacts.

input: Main types of grain debris in endogenous sedimentary rocks
expected_output: Endoclast, bioclastic, oolitic, pellet, agglomerate
actual_output: Main types of grain debris in endogenous sedimentary rocks include **clastic**, **chemical**, and **biogenic** materials.

input: The types of endogenous sedimentary rocks mainly include
expected_output: Aluminum rock, iron rock, manganese rock, phosphorous rock, evaporite, combustible organic rock, siliceous rock, carbonate rock
actual_output: igneous rocks, such as basalt and granite, and metamorphic rocks, such as marble and slate.

input: Main mineral composition in carbonate rocks
expected_output: Calcite, dolomite
actual_output: calcite and dolomite

input: Gutenberg noodles are__________ And___________ Interface.
expected_output: Mantle and core
actual_output: Gutenberg noodles are **the boundary between the Earth's crust and mantle** and **the Mohorovičić discontinuity**.

input: The types of volcanic eruption are_________ And_________ Two types.
expected_output: Crack type, central type
actual_output: The types of volcanic eruption are **effusive** and **explosive**. Two types.

input: Igneous rocks can be divided into ultrabasic, basic, neutral, acidic, vein rocks and other categories. Please list the names of one type of rocks in this order: __________, __________, ____________, ____________, __________.
expected_output: Peridotite, gabbro, andesite, rhyolite, pegmatite
actual_output: Peridotite, Basalt, Andesite, Rhyolite, Quartzite.

input: The Mesozoic era has existed from morning to night, and their codes are respectively.
expected_output: Triassic, Jurassic, Cretaceous, T, J, K
actual_output: The Mesozoic era has existed from approximately 252 to 66 million years ago, and its periods are respectively the Triassic, Jurassic, and Cretaceous.

input: Metamorphism includes ____________________ And___________ Three categories.
expected_output: Regional metamorphism, dynamic metamorphism, contact metamorphism
actual_output: Metamorphism includes **contact metamorphism** and **regional metamorphism**. Three categories.

input: Pyroclastic rocks can be divided into __________________ And_________ Three categories.
expected_output: Agglomerate, volcanic breccia, tuff
actual_output: Pyroclastic rocks can be divided into **ash**, **lapilli**, and **blocks/bombs**.

input: The three stages of rock deformation development are ___________, ____________ and ____________.
expected_output: Plastic deformation, elastic deformation, brittle deformation
actual_output: elastic deformation, plastic deformation, and brittle failure.

input: The geomagnetic elements include ______________________ And ___________;
expected_output: Magnetic declination, magnetic inclination and magnetic field strength
actual_output: The geomagnetic elements include declination, inclination, and intensity; and magnetic field strength.

input: According to the change of temperature and density, the atmosphere can be further divided into ___________, ___________, ______________________ And ___________.
expected_output: Troposphere, stratosphere, mesosphere, warm layer, escape layer
actual_output: troposphere, stratosphere, mesosphere, and thermosphere.

input: There are two most important seismic wave velocity change interfaces in the interior of the earth___________ And ___________, According to this, the interior of the earth can be divided into ______________________ And ___________.
expected_output: Moho surface, Gutenberg surface, crust, mantle, core
actual_output: There are two most important seismic wave velocity change interfaces in the interior of the earth **the Mohorovičić discontinuity (Moho)** and **the Gutenberg discontinuity**. According to this, the interior of the earth can be divided into **the crust and the mantle** and **the mantle and the outer core**.

input: According to the geological environment and physicochemical factors of metamorphism, metamorphism can be divided into __________, ______________________ And ___________.
expected_output: Dynamic metamorphism, contact metamorphism, regional metamorphism, migmatization
actual_output: regional metamorphism, contact metamorphism, and hydrothermal metamorphism.

input: The double metamorphic belts are located on the ocean side___________ ___________ parallel to it.
expected_output: High pressure and low temperature metamorphic zone
actual_output: The double metamorphic belts are located on the ocean side **and** **extend** parallel to it.

input: Chemical weathering includes several important chemical reactions, which are ___________, ___________, ______________________ And ___________.
expected_output: Oxidation, dissolution, hydrolysis, hydration, biochemical weathering
actual_output: oxidation, hydrolysis, carbonation, and dissolution.

input: The sea water movement mainly includes __________, ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Wave, tide, current, turbidity current
actual_output: The sea water movement mainly includes currents, tides, and waves.

input: Glaciers are divided into__________ And __________.
expected_output: Continental glacier
actual_output: Glaciers are divided into alpine glaciers and continental glaciers.

input: According to the content of silica, magmatic rocks can be divided into __________, ____________________ And __________. (Indicate the content of silicon dioxide, otherwise the judgment is wrong)
expected_output: Ultrabasic rock SiO2<45%, basic rock SiO245-52%, neutral rock SiO252-65%, acidic rock SiO2>65%
actual_output: According to the content of silica, magmatic rocks can be divided into felsic, intermediate, and mafic.

input: The diagenesis of sediments mainly includes ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Compaction
actual_output: The diagenesis of sediments mainly includes compaction and cementation.

input: The color of sedimentary rocks can be divided into ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Inherited color, primary color, secondary color
actual_output: The color of sedimentary rocks can be divided into **light-colored** and **dark-colored**.

input: The structural types of carbonate rocks mainly include ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Grain structure
actual_output: The structural types of carbonate rocks mainly include **clastic** and **non-clastic**.

input: The common grains in carbonate rocks include __________, ____________________ And__________ Etc.
expected_output: Endoclast, bioclastic, oolitic, agglomerate
actual_output: calcite, aragonite, dolomite.

input: The sedimentary types of alluvial fan include __________, ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Debris flow deposit, braided channel deposit, overflow deposit, sieve deposit
actual_output: gravel, sand, and silt.

input: According to the plane geometry of the river, the river can be divided into __________, ____________________ And__________ Four types.
expected_output: Pingzhi River, meandering river, braided river, reticulated river
actual_output: According to the plane geometry of the river, the river can be divided into straight, meandering, braided, and anastomosing. Four types.

input: The river facies can be further divided into __________, ____________________ River__________ Four subfacies.
expected_output: River bed, embankment, river apron, oxbow lake
actual_output: The river facies can be further divided into braided, meandering, anastomosing, and straight River Four subfacies.

input: According to the depth of the lake and its geographical location, the clastic lake facies can be divided into __________, __________, ____________________ And__________ Wait for several subphases.
expected_output: Lake delta, shore lake, shallow lake, semi-deep lake, deep lake
actual_output: According to the depth of the lake and its geographical location, the clastic lake facies can be divided into shallow lake facies, deep lake facies, deltaic facies, and shoreline facies. Wait for several subphases.

input: Galloway's genetic types of delta include ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: River controlled delta, wave controlled delta, tidal controlled delta
actual_output: Galloway's genetic types of delta include **river-dominated**, **wave-dominated**, and **tide-dominated**.

input: A typical modern barrier-free coastal sedimentary environment can be divided into __________, ____________________ And__________ Wait for several secondary environments.
expected_output: Coastal dunes, backshore, foreshore, nearshore
actual_output: A typical modern barrier-free coastal sedimentary environment can be divided into **shoreface**, **foreshore**, and **backshore**. Wait for several secondary environments.

input: The types of subfacies of barrier coastal facies are ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Lagoon subfacies, tidal flat subfacies, barrier island subfacies
actual_output: The types of subfacies of barrier coastal facies are beach ridges and tidal flats.

input: The carbonate sedimentary facies zone is divided into ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Supratidal zone
actual_output: The carbonate sedimentary facies zone is divided into **the inner ramp** and **the outer ramp**.

input: The basic form of fold is__________ And __________.
expected_output: Anticline
actual_output: The basic form of fold is **anticline** and **syncline**.

input: According to the mechanical properties at the time of formation, joints can be divided into__________ And__________ Two types.
expected_output: Shear joint
actual_output: tectonic joints and exfoliation joints.

input: According to the relative displacement relationship between the two walls of the fault, it can be divided into __________, __________ There are four types of translation fault and hinge fault.
expected_output: Normal fault
actual_output: normal, reverse (or) strike-slip

input: The primary structural unit within the petroliferous basin is ____________________ And __________.
expected_output: Uplift, depression, slope
actual_output: The primary structural unit within the petroliferous basin is a **structural trap** and **reservoir rock**.

input: The boundaries between plates are __________, ____________________ And__________ Four types.
expected_output: Hailing, transform fault, subduction zone and deep trench, ground suture
actual_output: The boundaries between plates are **divergent**, **convergent**, and **transform**. Four types.

input: Gutenberg noodles are__________ And___________ Interface.
expected_output: Mantle and core
actual_output: Gutenberg noodles are **the boundary between the Earth's crust and mantle** and **the Mohorovičić discontinuity**.

input: The types of volcanic eruption are_________ And_________ Two types.
expected_output: Crack type, central type
actual_output: The types of volcanic eruption are **effusive** and **explosive**. Two types.

expected_output: (Moho, Gutenberg, crust, mantle, core)
actual_output: There are two most important seismic wave velocity variation boundaries in the interior of the earth, namely the **Mohorovičić discontinuity (Moho)** and the **Gutenberg discontinuity**. According to this, the interior of the earth can be divided into the **crust and mantle** and the **mantle and core**.

input: According to the energy sources and characteristics that cause geological work, it can be divided into internal energy and external energy, which include ___________, ____________, ___________, _______________________ And____________
expected_output: (Heavy energy, radioactive energy, page 4 of 8, rotational energy, crystal energy and chemical energy, solar radiation energy, solar and lunar gravitational energy)
actual_output: According to the energy sources and characteristics that cause geological work, it can be divided into internal energy and external energy, which include **tectonic forces**, **volcanic activity**, **earthquakes**, **isostatic adjustments**, and **weathering and erosion**.

input: According to the geological environment and physicochemical factors of metamorphism, metamorphism can be divided into __________, ______________________ And___________
expected_output: (dynamic metamorphism, contact metamorphism, regional metamorphism, migmatization)
actual_output: According to the geological environment and physicochemical factors of metamorphism, metamorphism can be divided into contact metamorphism, regional metamorphism, and hydrothermal metamorphism.

input: Chemical weathering includes several important chemical reactions, which are ___________, ___________, ______________________ And___________
expected_output: (oxidation, dissolution, hydrolysis, hydration, biochemical weathering)
actual_output: Chemical weathering includes several important chemical reactions, which are hydrolysis, oxidation, carbonation, and dissolution.

input: The main factors affecting weathering are___________ And___________
expected_output: (Physical and geographical conditions, lithology)
actual_output: The main factors affecting weathering are climate and rock type.

input: The loose deposits on the surface are passed by the wind ______________________ And___________ Transport to other places
expected_output: (suspension, jump, push)
actual_output: The loose deposits on the surface are passed by the wind **through a process called deflation** and **are transported** to other places.

input: Aeolian deposits include__________ And___________
expected_output: (eolian sand, eolian loess)
actual_output: Aeolian deposits include **sand dunes** and **loess**.

input: According to the existing form of water in minerals and its role in the crystal structure of minerals, it can be divided into __________, __________, ____________________ And__________
expected_output: (adsorbed water, crystal water, structural water, zeolite water, interlayer water)
actual_output: zeolitic water, adsorbed water, occluded water, and structural water.

input: According to the content of silica, magmatic rocks can be divided into __________, ____________________ And__________
expected_output: (Ultrabasic rock SiO2<45%, basic rock SiO245-52%, neutral rock SiO252-65%, acidic rock SiO2>65%)
actual_output: According to the content of silica, magmatic rocks can be divided into felsic, intermediate, and mafic rocks.

input: The diagenesis of sediments mainly includes ____________________ And__________
expected_output: (compaction, cementation, recrystallization)
actual_output: The diagenesis of sediments mainly includes compaction and cementation.

input: The color of sedimentary rocks can be divided into ____________________ And__________
expected_output: (Inherited color, primary color, secondary color)
actual_output: The color of sedimentary rocks can be divided into **light-colored** and **dark-colored**.

input: The structural types of carbonate rocks mainly include ____________________ And__________
expected_output: (particle structure, biological skeleton structure, grain structure)
actual_output: The structural types of carbonate rocks mainly include **clastic**, and **non-clastic**.

input: The common grains in carbonate rocks include __________, ____________________ And__________ etc.
expected_output: (endoclastic, bioclastic, oolitic, agglomerate)
actual_output: calcite, aragonite, dolomite.

expected_output: Triassic, Jurassic, Cretaceous, T, J, K

To complete the sentence meaningfully, we need more context about what "their codes" refers to. However, I can provide a general structure based on common scenarios in college geoscience:

"Each mineral sample, their codes are respectively labeled with unique identifiers based on their chemical composition and crystal structure."

input: From morning to night in the Mesozoic era
expected_output: Regional metamorphism, dynamic metamorphism, contact metamorphism
actual_output: From morning to night in the Mesozoic era, the Earth's climate was generally warmer and more humid than today, supporting a diverse range of dinosaur species and lush vegetation. This era, spanning approximately 186 million years, is divided into three periods: the Triassic, Jurassic, and Cretaceous. During this time, the supercontinent Pangaea began to break apart, leading to the formation of modern continents and significant geological and climatic changes. The Mesozoic is often referred to as the "Age of Reptiles" due to the dominance of dinosaurs, but it also saw the rise of early mammals and flowering plants.

input: Metamorphism includes ____________________ And___________ Three categories.
expected_output: Standard, standard, cycle, cycle, environment, environment
actual_output: Metamorphism includes **contact metamorphism** and **regional metamorphism**. Three categories.

input: When dividing the strata of a region, it is generally to establish a___________ Section. All sections with complete stratigraphic exposure, normal sequence, clear contact relationship and well preserved fossils can be used as___________ Section. Such a change is called a deposit ___________, That is, each set of transgressive horizon and regressive horizon constitutes a complete sedimentary ___________. Strata can also be divided according to lithology. The lithologic change reflects the sedimentation to a certain extent___________ Changes, while deposition___________ The change of the earth's crust is often closely related to the crustal movement. Therefore, the strata are divided into many units according to lithology, which can basically represent the development stage of local geological history________ and
expected_output: Physical weathering, chemical weathering, biological weathering
actual_output: When dividing the strata of a region, it is generally to establish a **standard** Section. All sections with complete stratigraphic exposure, normal sequence, clear contact relationship and well preserved fossils can be used as **reference** Section. If it is marine strata, it often shows repeated changes of lithofacies from coarse to fine and from fine to coarse. Such a change is called a deposit **cycle**, That is, each set of transgressive horizon and regressive horizon constitutes a complete sedimentary **cycle**. Strata can also be divided according to lithology. The lithologic change reflects the sedimentation to a certain extent **environmental** Changes, while deposition **processes**. The change of the earth's crust is

input: Most earthquakes are generated by brittle rocks in the earth's crust, and seismic energy is transmitted in a certain way. It is commonly used to measure the intensity of energy released by an earthquake.
expected_output: Fault, seismic wave, magnitude
actual_output: Most earthquakes are generated by brittle rocks in the earth's crust, and seismic energy is transmitted in a certain way. It is commonly used to measure the intensity of energy released by an earthquake using the **Richter scale** or **moment magnitude scale**.
